page.title: 03THE SCALAN IN THE BRAES
page.content: High up in the hills from where any intruder can easily be spotted, there is the former seminary of the Scalan. In 1712 Bishop Gordon chose the Scalan to build a college where boys could train as missionaries. It was the only training place in Scotland for students to the priesthood at that time. The original building was mostly of turf and could accomodate eight students, but after being raided and burned to the ground on four occasions between 1717 and 1746 it was rebuilt and improved. After the Battle of Culloden the College was left in peace and over the years more than 100 priests and 2 bishops were ordained. In 1799 the Bishop and students left the Scalan to set up a new college in Aberdeenshire. Today the building is preserved by the Scalan Association and is visited by many people.
